overview_of_class:
Physiology. Fundamental mechanisms underlying the function of the major organ systems in mammals will be covered. Emphasis will be placed on molecular and cellular mechanisms underlying physiological processes, and on the integration among the major organs systems to achieve homeostatic and sensorimotor function.
Topics will include neural, renal, cardiovascular, respiratory and autonomic/somatic motor physiology.
name: Physiology
title: WCAS BIOL_SCI 217-0-20 Physiology
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Prerequisite: Students must have completed CHEM 102-0 or CHEM 171-0 to register for this course.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Physiology. Fundamental mechanisms underlying the function of the major organ systems in mammals will be covered. Emphasis will be placed on molecular and cellular mechanisms underlying physiological processes, and on the integration among the major organs systems to achieve homeostatic and sensorimotor function.
Topics will include neural, renal, cardiovascular, respiratory and autonomic/somatic motor physiology.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lectures supplemented with student centered question/answer sessions.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Weekly quizzes, in-class participation, midterms, and final examination

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Human Physiology: An Integrated Approach, 7th Edition, by Dee Unglaub Silverthorn, Pearon Publishing.
ISBN: 13: 978-0321981226
Students are required to have a ResponseCard NXT or QT Device from Turning
Technologies.

class_attributes:
Natural Sciences Distro Area

Prerequisites apply, see description
subject: BIOL_SCI

overview_of_class: Mammalian physiology. Fundamental mechanisms underlying the function of the major organ systems in mammals will be covered. Emphasis will be placed on molecular and cellular mechanisms underlying physiological processes, and on the integration among the major organs systems to achieve homeostatic and sensorimotor function. Topics will include neural, renal, cardiovascular, respiratory, autonomic/somatic motor, and immunological physiology.

descriptions.value: Mammalian physiology. Fundamental mechanisms underlying the function of the major organ systems in mammals will be covered. Emphasis will be placed on molecular and cellular mechanisms underlying physiological processes, and on the integration among the major organs systems to achieve homeostatic and sensorimotor function. descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Human Physiology: An integrated Approach (7th ed.) by Dee Unglaub Silverthorn ISBN: 978-0321981226
NOTE: You do NOT need the "Mastering A&P" supplemental materials.
